segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 11. Valāhakavagga
segments.en: 11. Clouds

segments.pli: 103. Kumbhasutta
segments.en: 103. Pots

segments.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, kumbhā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four pots.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Tuccho pihito, pūro vivaṭo, tuccho vivaṭo, pūro pihito—
segments.en:
1. Covered but hollow,
  2. uncovered but full,
  3. uncovered and hollow, and
  4. covered and full.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro kumbhā.
segments.en: These are the four pots.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro kumbhūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, these four people similar to pots are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Tuccho pihito, pūro vivaṭo, tuccho vivaṭo, pūro pihito.
segments.en:
1. Covered but hollow,
  2. uncovered but full,
  3. uncovered and hollow, and
  4. covered and full.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo tuccho hoti pihito?
segments.en: And how is a person covered but hollow?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is impressive when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and aside, when bending and extending the limbs, and when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes.

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: But they don’t truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo tuccho hoti pihito.
segments.en: That’s how a person is covered but hollow.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, kumbho tuccho pihito;
segments.en: That person is like a pot that’s covered but hollow, I say.

segments.pli: tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo pūro hoti vivaṭo?
segments.en: And how is a person uncovered but full?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is not impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: But they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo pūro hoti vivaṭo.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, kumbho pūro vivaṭo;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo tuccho hoti vivaṭo?
segments.en: And how is a person uncovered and hollow?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is not impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: Nor do they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo tuccho hoti vivaṭo.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, kumbho tuccho vivaṭo;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo pūro hoti pihito?
segments.en: And how is a person covered and full?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: And they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo pūro hoti pihito.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, kumbho pūro pihito;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro kumbhūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These four people similar to pots are found in the world.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.
